title: Ang Nawalang Kapatid
description: Ang Nawalang Kapatid, adapted from The Mahabharata by acclaimed playwright Floy Quintos, with original score by Ceejay Javier, directed and choreographed by Dexter M. Santos, is a re-telling of the epic battle between the  Kaurava and Pandava families. The story focuses on the anti-hero Karna, a brave young man who must choose between loyalty to his family or to the state which made him a prince.
creator: Floy Quintos, Dexter Santos
location: Wilfrido Ma. Guerrero Theater, 2nd floor Palma Hall, University of the Philippines Diliman
subject: adaptation; theatre; dup; season39

title: Bilanggo ng Pag-ibig
description: Bilanggo ng Pag-ibig is an adaptation of Genet’s masterpiece Un Captif Amoureux (Prisoner of Love). Genet’s final opus is a lyrical and philosophical voyage to the bloody intersection of oppression, terror, and desire at the heart of the contemporary world. The play, then, seeks to understand and portray Genet’s imagination as well as his controversial insights on revolution, betrayal and deceit, homosexuality, violence, and love. Bilanggo ng Pag-ibig, therefore, is a response to Genet's daring claim and provocation: "The end pursued by revolution is the discovery of beauty."
creator: Rody Vera, Jose Estrella
location: Wilfrido Ma. Guerrero Theater, 2nd floor Palma Hall, University of the Philippines Diliman
subject: theatre; dup; season39

title: William Shakespeare's Measure for Measure/Hakbang sa Hakbang
description: One of William Shakespeare’s best-known plays, Measure for Measure, opens Dulaang UP’s 39th season and celebrates Shakespeare’s 450th birth anniversary. In Measure for Measure, one is invited to examine these themes against a backdrop of a city that is in a steady moral decline--a most fitting juxtaposition with our country’s current socio-political milieu.
creator: Ron Capinding, Alexander Cortez
location: Wilfrido Ma. Guerrero Theater, 2nd floor Palma Hall, University of the Philippines Diliman
subject: shakespeare; theatre; dup; season39

title: Ang Huling Lagda ni Apolinario Mabini
description: Ang Huling Lagda ni Apolinario Mabini re-imagines the hero’s exile in Guam and the painful conditions that allowed for his return to the Philippines. The new musical, with book and libretto by Floy Quintos, original music by Krina Cayabyab, and direction and choreography by Dexter M. Santos, hopes to explore the private pain of this great thinker in the face of betrayal and the failure of the Revolution he had dedicated his life to.
creator: Floy Quintos, Dexter Santos
location: Wilfrido Ma. Guerrero Theater, 2nd floor Palma Hall, University of the Philippines Diliman
subject: musical; theatre; dup; season 39

title: The Country Wife/Ang Misis kong Promdi
description: The Country Wife/ Ang Misis kong Promdi’s plot revolves around the lives of men and women belonging to high society; lives that are entangled in the paradox of love, marriage, reputation, mores, sexual conduct, and politics. A notorious philanderer’s homecoming ignites a series of infidelities and indiscretions. An innocent young woman from the countryside speaks honestly of her thoughts and desires posing a challenge to the gendered norms and moral codes of 16th and 17th century London.
creator: Nicolas Pichay, Tony Mabesa
location: Wilfrido Ma. Guerrero Theater, 2nd floor Palma Hall, University of the Philippines Diliman
subject: adaptation; theatre; dup; season39

title: #R(Heart)J
description: #R(Heart)J retells the story of the star-crossed lovers transforming Verona into a concrete jungle at the heart of Metro Manila – teeming with corruption, revolt, advertisements, sex, social media and condominium units. This theatrical project seeks to dramatize, through a pastiche of movement, music, intertext, video and design, the postmodern tragedy of our generation.
creator: Guelan Varela-Luarca, Dexter Santos
location: Wilfrido Ma. Guerrero Theater, 2nd floor Palma Hall, University of the Philippines Diliman
subject: shakespeare; theatre; dup; season40

title: King Lear/Haring Lear
description: The play is set in the waning years of a Southeast Asian kingdom replete with appropriate music, movement, costumes, and properties of the region without losing the themes, images, and poetry of the playwright’s supreme achievement. King Lear | Haring Lear is the epitome of how deceit and the love for the superficial can tragically bring families to ruin and great kingdoms to ashes.
creator: Nicolas Pichay, Tony Mabesa
location: Wilfrido Ma. Guerrero Theater, 2nd floor Palma Hall, University of the Philippines Diliman
subject: adaptation; theatre; dup; season40

title: Tisoy Brown: Hari ng Wala, based on Henrik Ibsen's Peer Gynt
description: Kawangis ng pakikipagsapalaran ni Peer Gynt sa mahiwagang mundo ng Noruega, tunghayan si Tisoy Brown sa kanyang paglalayag sa laot ng dagat, pagbagtas sa kasukalan ng gubat, paglipad sa himpapawid, at pakikipagdaupang-palad sa mga nilalang na pawang tauhan ng mga bantog na kwentong-bayan ng ating mayamang kulturang Pilipino.
creator: Rody Vera, Jose Estrella
location: Wilfrido Ma. Guerrero Theater, 2nd floor Palma Hall, University of the Philippines Diliman
subject: theatre; dup; season40

title: The Dressing Room: That Which Flows Away Ultimately Becomes Nostalgia
description: A story of actors preparing for their performance of Anton Chekhov’s The Seagull, The Dressing Room | Ang Dressing Room features seasoned theatre, film, and television actors, Frances Makil-Ignacio, Ces Quesada, Missy Maramara, Maxine Ignacio, Roeder Camañag, Bobby Martino, and Mitoy Sta. Ana, along with theatre students Hariette Damole, Jude Servilla, and the DUP ensemble.
creator: Alexander Cortez
location: Wilfrido Ma. Guerrero Theater, 2nd floor Palma Hall, University of the Philippines Diliman
subject: theatre; dup; season40

title: William Shakespeare's Comedy of Errors/Ang Katatawanan ng Kalituhan
description: A cleverly crafted tale of mistaken identities, loves lost and found, families gone astray and made whole again.
creator: Guelan Varela-Luarca, Alexander Cortez
location: Wilfrido Ma. Guerrero Theater, 2nd floor Palma Hall, University of the Philippines Diliman
subject: shakespeare; theatre; dup; season41

title: Distrito de Molo
description: Distrito de Molo - three one act plays by Leoncio Deriada (Filipino translation by Allan Palileo) directed by Tony Mabesa.
creator: Tony Mabesa
location: Wilfrido Ma. Guerrero Theater, 2nd floor Palma Hall, University of the Philippines Diliman
subject: one-act-play; theatre; dup; season41

title: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe's Faust
description: The play opens in heaven where the devil, Mephisto, wagers with God that he can corrupt his most virtuous servant FAUST. What follows in the play is a series of events that questions our preconceived notions of justice, rationality, and morality.
creator: Rody Vera, Jose Estrella
location: Wilfrido Ma. Guerrero Theater, 2nd floor Palma Hall, University of the Philippines Diliman
subject: adaptation; theatre; dup; season41

title: Angry Christ
description: In “Angry Christ” the prolific playwright Floy Quintos sought to imagine how the Fil-American painter Alfonso Ossorio created the controversial mural, “The Last Judgment,” and in the process created his own masterpiece that has been gloriously brought to life by the University of the Philippines Playwrights’ Theater and Dulaang UP.
creator: Floy Quintos, Dexter Santos
location: Wilfrido Ma. Guerrero Theater, 2nd floor Palma Hall, University of the Philippines Diliman
subject: theatre; dup; season41

title: Nick Joaquin's Fathers and Sons/Mga Ama, Mga Anak
description: Set in the mid 70’s, this three-act play revolves around a day in the life of Zacarias Monzon, a man once known as the Caritela King. During the last few days of his life, he attempts to regain his reputation while reminiscing his past wealth, power, and success. The play dares to reveal the cycle of atrocities that linger in a patriarchal household as it resonates themes of identity, resistance, and acceptance.
creator: Tony Mabesa
location: Wilfrido Ma. Guerrero Theater, 2nd floor Palma Hall, University of the Philippines Diliman
subject: three-act-play; theatre; dup; season42

title: Aurelio Tolentino's Bagong Cristo
description: Written in 1907, this socialist drama revolves around Jesus Gatbiaya, a labor leader whose teachings empowered fellow laborers to fight against social injustice and inequality. The play shows how Christ’s passion is lived by a man who is willing to offer his life for the liberation of his people.
creator: Alexander Cortez
location: Wilfrido Ma. Guerrero Theater, 2nd floor Palma Hall, University of the Philippines Diliman
subject: theatre; dup; season42

title: Ang Dalagita’y ‘Sang Bagay na Di-Buo
description: A harrowing piece about the tragic story of a Girl plagued by the appalling inquities of sexual abuse and power.
creator: Rody Vera, Jose Estrella
location: Wilfrido Ma. Guerrero Theater, 2nd floor Palma Hall, University of the Philippines Diliman
subject: one-woman-act; theatre; dup; season42

title: The Kundiman Party
description: Resistance is exemplified by THE KUNDIMAN PARTY, a highlight of the 26th season , which opened to critical acclaim in  2018 . A revival of the show also highlighted PETA's 2019 season.
creator: Floy Quintos, Dexter Santos
location: Wilfrido Ma. Guerrero Theater, 2nd floor Palma Hall, University of the Philippines Diliman
subject: musical; theatre; dup; season 42

title: Six Characters in Search of an Author / Anim na Tauhang Naghahanap ng May-akda
description: A masterpiece of modern theater written in 1921, Six Characters in Search of an Author / Anim na Tauhang Naghahanap ng May-Akda is a meta-drama about six characters looking to finish their stories as they take the audience into a rumination on the distinction between illusion and reality.
creator: Luigi Pirandello, Tony Mabesa
location: Wilfrido Ma. Guerrero Theater, 2nd floor Palma Hall, University of the Philippines Diliman
subject: theatre; dup; season43

title: Nana Rosa
description: Nana Rosa is based on the life of Maria Rosa Luna Henson, the first Filipino Comfort Woman to make her story public.
creator: Rody Vera, Jose Estrella
location: Wilfrido Ma. Guerrero Theater, 2nd floor Palma Hall, University of the Philippines Diliman
subject: theatre; dup; season43

title: Ang Tahanan ni Bernarda Alba
description: Known to be the last work of renowned Spanish playwright Federico Garcia Lorca, Ang Tahanan ni Bernarda Alba | The House of Bernarda Alba tackles themes of honor, tyranny, and religious hypocrisy.
creator: Alexander Cortez
location: Wilfrido Ma. Guerrero Theater, 2nd floor Palma Hall, University of the Philippines Diliman
subject: theatre; dup; season44

title: Fuente Ovejuna
description: Based on a historical incident that took place in the town of Fuente Ovejuna, Castile in 1476, the play centers on a feudal overlord, the cruel and sex-crazed Commendador Fernan Gomez De Guzman. The residents of Fuente Ovejuna, after years of oppressive rule, band together to end their misery.
creator: Nicolas Pichay, Tony Mabesa
location: Wilfrido Ma. Guerrero Theater, 2nd floor Palma Hall, University of the Philippines Diliman
subject: theatre; dup; season44

title: The Reconciliation Dinner
description: In the aftermath of the 2022 elections, a group of friends gather to try and heal the divides caused by their own political affiliations. The dinner results in life-altering choices for all of them.
creator: Floy Quintos, Dexter Santos
location: University Theatre, University of the Philippines Diliman
subject: one-act-play; theatre; dup; season45

title: Kung Paano Nanalo sa Karera si Rosang Taba
description: Ito ay kuwento kung paano hinamon ng matabang babae na si Rosa ang mapagmataas na kampeon ng mga Ispancialo na si Pietrado sa isang karera na nagpapakita kung paano binago ng katapangan, katalinuhan, at determinasyon ng isang babae ang kasaysayan ng mga Hinirang.
creator: José Estrella, Issa Manalo Lopez,Mark Daniel Dalacat.
location: University Theatre, University of the Philippines Diliman
subject: theatre; dup; season45
